Note that this is the mpi_collectives operation for which I'm not the author, but the problem in this case is most likely that you did not build your MPI environment with GPU/CUDA support. Without that support the MPI calls that get GPU pointers as argument will fail.
See: https://www.open-mpi.org/faq/?category=building#build-cuda

Note that this is the `mpi_collectives` operation for which I'm not the author, but the problem in this case is most likely that you did not build your MPI environment with GPU/CUDA support. Without that support the MPI calls that get GPU pointers as argument will fail. 
See: https://www.open-mpi.org/faq/?category=building#build-cuda
